```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(magrittr)
library(knitr)
library(ggplot2)
library(labelled)
library(haven)

```

Confirm working directory 
```{r, echo=FALSE}
getwd()

```

Get data 
```{r, echo=FALSE}
TASS2 <- read.csv(file = '8557_WUSTL-Weidenbaum05_Redacted.csv', header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

```



Demographics:


Party Identification
```{r, echo=FALSE}
TASS2$PartyID7 <- to_factor(TASS2$PartyID7)
TASS2$PartyID7 <- recode(TASS2$PartyID7, "-1" = "Unknown", "1" = "Strong Democrat", "2" = "Moderate Democrat", "3" = "Lean Democrat", "4" = "Don't Lean/Independent/None", "5" = "Lean Republican", "6" = "Moderate Republican", "7" = "Strong Republican")

TASS2 %>%
  group_by(PartyID7) %>% 
  summarise(n=n()) %>% 
  mutate(PartyID7perc = prop.table(n)*100) %>% 
  kable(digits = 2, caption = "Party Identification",col.names = c("Response", "Frequency", "Percentage"))

ggplot(data = TASS2) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = PartyID7, y = ..prop.., group = 1), stat = "count") + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +  
  xlab("Response") +
  ylab("Percentage") +
ggtitle("Party Identification")
```


tabulator

New variable to filter by ideology
```{r, echo=FALSE}

TASS2 <- TASS2 %>%
mutate(pol_orientation = ifelse(IDEO = -1, "unknown", IDEO = 1,2,3, "liberal", IDEO = 4, "moderate", IDEO = 5,6,7, "conservative"))

```

Ignore
```{r}
Females<-hw2_fact%>% 
 filter(sex=="Female")%>% 
  summarise(n=n())

 FemalesVH<-hw2_fact%>%
 filter(sex == "Female")%>% 
 filter(happy == "Very Happy") %>% 
   summarise(n=n()) %>% 
FemalePercent<-FemalesVH/Females*100
kable(FemalePercent, digits=2, caption = "Percentage of all women who are Very Happy")
```


TEST TEST TEST FILTER
```{r, echo=FALSE}
TASS2$ADS3_A <- to_factor(TASS2$ADS3_A)
TASS2$ADS3_A <- recode(TASS2$ADS3_A, "1" = "A Great Deal", "2" = "A Fair Amount", "3" = "Not Very Much", "4" = "None at All", "77" = "Don't Know", "98" = "Skipped on web", "99" = "Refused")


TASS2$PartyID7 <- recode(TASS2$PartyID7, "-1" = "Unknown", "1" = "Strong Democrat", "2" = "Moderate Democrat", "3" = "Lean Democrat", "4" = "Don't Lean/Independent/None", "5" = "Lean Republican", "6" = "Moderate Republican", "7" = "Strong Republican")


 TASS2 %>%
  group_by(ADS3_A) %>% 
  filter(PartyID7 ==  "Strong Democrat" | PartyID7 == "Moderate Democrat"| PartyID7 == "Lean Democrat")
 summarise(n=n()) %>% 
 mutate(ADS3_Aperc = prop.table(n)*100) %>% 
  kable(digits = 2, caption = "Facebook, liberals",col.names = c("Response", "Frequency", "Percentage"))

ggplot(data = TASS2) + 
 geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = ADS3_A, y = ..prop.., group = 1), stat = "count") + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +  
 xlab("Response") +
 ylab("Percentage") +
ggtitle("How much trust and confidence do you have in Facebook to appropriately handle political advertising?")


```

POLITICAL ADS

Scale: 1	Strongly agree
2	Agree
3	Agree only a little (edited to "Slightly Agree" in analyses to fit graphs)
4	Disagree only a little (edited to "Slightly Disagree" in analyses to fit graphs)
5	Disagree
6	Strongly disagree
77	DON'T KNOW
98	SKIPPED ON WEB
99	REFUSED


ADS4_A: Political ads should be removed if they contain false information.
```{r, echo=FALSE}

```

ADS4_N: Microtargeting political ads to specific audiences based on things like age, gender, and race should not be permitted. 
```{r, echo=FALSE}
TASS2$ADS4_N <- to_factor(TASS2$ADS4_N)
TASS2$ADS4_N <- recode(TASS2$ADS4_N, "1" = "Strongly Agree", "2" = "Agree", "3" = "Slightly Agree", "4" = "Slightly Disagree", "5" = "Disagree", "6" = "Strongly Disagree", "77" = "Don't Know", "98" = "Skipped on web", "99" = "Refused")

TASS2 %>%
  group_by(ADS4_N) %>% 
  summarise(n=n()) %>% 
  mutate(ADS4_Nperc = prop.table(n)*100) %>% 
  kable(digits = 2, caption = "Microtargeting political ads to specific audiences based on things like age, gender, and race should not be permitted. ", col.names = c("Response", "Frequency", "Percentage"))

ggplot(data = TASS2) + 
  geom_bar(mapping = aes(x = ADS4_N, y = ..prop.., group = 1), stat = "count") + 
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format()) +  
  xlab("Response") +
  ylab("Percentage") +
ggtitle("Microtargeting political ads to specific audiences based on things like age, gender, and race should not be permitted.")
```
